sentences.english: Entirely devoted to the Party, the young soldier gave his life for his country.
sentences.chinese: 對黨無限忠誠，這位年輕的士兵爲祖國獻出了生命。

sentences.english: If you do, two loyalty counters are removed from that planeswalker.
sentences.chinese: 若你如此做，從該旅法師上移去兩個忠誠度指示物。

sentences.english: Christian dedication and faithfulness in worshiping, studying the Word, receiving the sacrament.
sentences.chinese: 在做禮拜，學習聖經，領聖餐時基督徒的奉獻和忠誠。

sentences.english: He was a strongly committed comrade of the Party.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個對黨非常忠誠的同志。

sentences.english: Even my preferred product is currently out-of-stock , I am still loyal to the website.
sentences.chinese: 即使我喜愛的商品暫時缺貨，我仍然會忠誠於此網站。

sentences.english: The party was kept together by personal loyalty to the leader.
sentences.chinese: 這個黨是靠對領袖的個人忠誠而維繫在一起的。

sentences.english: He was always loyal to the Party.
Fromthat day on, we were ever so faithful to Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 從那天起，我們對耶穌無比的忠誠又更深一層了。

sentences.english: The victor would win Toydaria's allegiance.
sentences.chinese: 勝利者將贏得託伊達里亞的忠誠。

sentences.english: In my old griefs, and with my childhood's faith.
sentences.chinese: 愛你，以昔日的劇痛和童年的忠誠。

sentences.english: I. Guard yourself from being influenced by them to compromise your loyalty of God.
sentences.chinese: 對他們的影響作出提防，免致於對神的忠誠作出妥協。

sentences.english: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
sentences.chinese: 患難時倚靠不忠誠的人，好像破壞的牙，錯骨縫的腳。

sentences.english: Sunspear stayed loyal to my father when the Usurper stole his throne.
sentences.chinese: 太陽矛在篡權者偷了我父親的皇冠後一直對他忠誠。

sentences.english: He is so honest that he will not accept bribe.
People do not want to get hurt, and will avoid you if aren’t loyal.
sentences.chinese: 人都不希望受傷害，如果你不忠誠，她們就會避開你。

definition: to hold fast to/to stick to
to trust/to have confidence in/to have faith in/to rely on
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
